body:
Looks good to me.

CI failure is unrelated

```
  ZeppelinIT.testSparkInterpreterDependencyLoading:214->AbstractZeppelinIT.createNewNote:133 Â» Timeout
```

Which is tracked under [ZEPPELIN-928](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-928) and is different from one fixed in #862

It's different issue now - I have found the reason of CI failure and described at [ZEPPELIN-878](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-878). Will fix it from there.

@prasadwagle I think it's good to merge now, as soon as you address felix's feedback

Looks good to me.

May be in PR description it's better to mention that it's not Zeppelin modification but a helper script for PR merge.
@cloverhearts  have tested this, works fine with me. Problem that I found for now is the list is case sensitive sort, where as every where else its case insensitive sort.

Hi all,
I can confirm, using release 0.5.6 and external Spark 1.5.1 cdh 5.5, I must add to zeppelin-env.sh `ZEPPELIN_INTP_JAVA_OPTS="-Dspark.yarn.isPython=true"` with master `yarn-client`

Maybe it's better to add it in the documentation?

Cheers,
Luca

@prabhjyotsingh Thank you for your feedback. While I can solve some problems with the current optimization. Your opinion is right. I will solve the problem. Thanks again.

have a good day.

@bzz Just commented on ZEPPELIN-902 - My concern was on my local build, not on Travis stability.
As mentionned onthe JIRA, the target `target` folder is not present after a clean, because the download-pyspark-files is binded to the `validate` phase.

I guess using ${basedir} could do the job, but then we are not 100% safe because building in the spark-dependencies folder would put the spark-dist at a different location... 

Maybe ${session.executionRootDirectory} ? (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3084629/finding-the-root-directory-of-a-multi-module-maven-reactor-project).

Another approach would be to bind to the `compile` phase, but I guess it will have side-effects.
Thx, guys!
We also appreciate your contribution!
And almost forgot, looks very awesome!!!

CI passes, ready to be merged. 

This should fix CI on #860
thanks for fixing this flaky test, LGTM

@bzz Thanks for the comments, It builds fine on my machine, I wanted to see how it did against CI.  Been out of town for a wedding over the holiday weekend (in US Monday was a holiday). I didn't think anyone would look at it before today, and apologies for not outlining things more clearly.  Looking at the fail logs, it seems like flakey fails, but I'll investigate further this evening.  

@Leemoonsoo also thanks for the comments. 
I do have some documentation on this as well at:
https://trevorgrant.org/2016/05/19/visualizing-apache-mahout-in-r-via-apache-zeppelin-incubating/

I agree there are those two approaches, and will present a 3rd where 'Mahout' lives as it's own interpreter.

so approach (1) a patch, approach (2) documentation only, approach (3) a stand alone interpreter.

In general, options 1 and 3 make integrating Apache Mahout into notebooks more 'turn-key' and since one of the primary use cases of Apache Zeppelin is data discovery analytics, this seems like a natural fit that would benefit both projects AND end users.  Cons of 1 and 3 are that they add code that must be maintained; as far as invasiveness of patch and code which must be maintained, 1 is vastly superior to 3 (for 3 we would be basically copy and pasting the spark interpretter over with this patch applied). I do agree with Moon's comments above for paramter setting based on 'spark.mahout=true/false" this is to bzz's point WIP.

So pros/cons of approach 2 is in essence the inverse of 1 and 3. The pro: no additional code to maintain (though a blog post which must be maintained as I've learned the hard way re my post on Installing Zeppelin with Spark and Flink), the cons of which: while Zeppelin does make all of the steps required fairly easy, the steps required to add Mahout support would be at least fairly considered an "intermediate" Zeppelin skill level.  This is a barrier to entry to several Apache Mahout users who are excited to see this integration as a means for visualization in Mahout.

My .02.
LGTM
LGTM +1
LGTM

@ravicodder It's really good improvement indeed! I tested this PR with `shiro.ini` and it works well I think. 
I left some comments on `notebook.css` file. It's really tiny things :)

@H4ml3t Sorry for the confusion, I also confirmed that this commit is not included in 0.5.6 binary package by checking source code in http://www.apache.org/dyn/closer.cgi/incubator/zeppelin/0.5.6-incubating/zeppelin-0.5.6-incubating.tgz. Thanks for reporting, I will update the doc
Thanks @bzz. I think I addressed @felixcheung feedback. @felixcheung - can you please review?

@rawkintrevo Thanks for the explanation. Approach 1 to lower the barrier and keep maintenance minimum make sense.

**License**
Following new dependencies are introduced. They need to be addressed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/tree/master/zeppelin-distribution/src/bin_license

```
[INFO] |  +- it.unimi.dsi:fastutil:jar:7.0.11:compile
[INFO] |  \- com.tdunning:t-digest:jar:3.1:compile
[INFO] |  +- com.github.scopt:scopt_2.10:jar:3.3.0:compile
[INFO] |  \- com.github.haifengl:smile-plot:jar:1.1.0:compile
[INFO] |     +- com.github.haifengl:smile-core:jar:1.1.0:compile
[INFO] |     |  +- com.github.haifengl:smile-data:jar:1.1.0:compile

[INFO] |     |  \- com.github.haifengl:smile-graph:jar:1.1.0:compile
[INFO] |     \- org.swinglabs:swingx:jar:1.6.1:compile
[INFO] |        +- com.jhlabs:filters:jar:2.0.235:compile
[INFO] |        \- org.swinglabs:swing-worker:jar:1.1:compile
[INFO] |     +- com.thoughtworks.xstream:xstream:jar:1.4.4:compile
[INFO] |     |  +- xmlpull:xmlpull:jar:1.1.3.1:compile
[INFO] |     |  \- xpp3:xpp3_min:jar:1.1.4c:compile
```

Check dependency tree with `mvn package dependency:tree` command

**Dependency confliction**
Following dependency versions are different from dependency brought by Spark.

Mahout

```
com.esotericsoftware.kryo:kryo:jar:2.24:compile
com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core:jar:2.7.2:compile
```

Spark (1.6)

```
com.esotericsoftware.kryo:kryo:jar:2.21:compile
com.fasterxml.jackson.core:jackson-core:jar:2.4.4:compile
```

Can all conflicted dependencies be excluded ?

**Packaging**
If mahout requires to be loaded in spark executor's classpath, then adding mahout dependency in pom.xml will not be enough to work with Spark cluster. Could you clarify if mahout need to be loaded in spark executor?
Rebased and now ci is green.

@cloverhearts Thanks for the contribution!

What could be the reason for creating `JobManagerServer` instead of using existing `NotebookServer`?
Creating `JobManagerServer` seems results produce many duplicated codes.

Many methods in `JobManagerServer` have duplicated code from `NotebookServer`,
`JobManagerSocket` is identical to `NotebookSocket`,
`JobManagerSocketListener` is identical to `NotebookSocketListener`
`JobManagerWebSocketCreator` is identical to `NotebookWebSocketCreator`
`websocketCalls.jobManagerServer` has many duplicated code to `websocketCalls.notebookServer` in `websocketEvents.factory.js`

Can we just use NotebookServer or find a better way to minimize code duplication?
Do you mind add new configurations to https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/docs/install/install.md#zeppelin-configuration as well??

Thank you for prompt reviews!
Merging if there is no more disucssion
Since the cursor is moving in the text editor of the new paragraph, it should also go at the end of the line
@prasadwagle thank you! CI fix was merged, so may be we could try rebasing on master again and see if it makes CI happy here as well

@Leemoonsoo Thank you for the good opinion and Thank you for pointing out an important point.
There are two reasons.

First, I communication for the job manager is, I think I would go more of many in the future further, than maybe notebook message. Therefore, I felt the need to separate the part that processes the message. This is expected to reduce confusion in the development of the future. 

Second, duplicate code, I think also that it is a problem. However, when you use a class named notebook socket for job communication in jobmanager, misleading, it was thought to be able to misleading developers. I can integrate it again, it is being modified to remove the duplicate.
@bzz @janzhongi, Let's kick off

Congratulations, apache zeppelin!


@jongyoul could you please create a new JIRA issue with label `flaky-test` for it?

Otherwise, converging interpreters to JDBC looks great to me!

May be we should keep in docs somewhere a notice for Hive users, something like "If you want to use Hive - please use it though JDBC interpreter, configuring it like this ...", how do you think?

So if somebody wants to use Zeppelin with Hive - he should be able to understand from the website\docs that it is indeed supported use-case, and he should be using JDBC (and not a special interpreter \w ThriftClient)

Looks great to me. 
Let's merge after reverting placeholder text back.

Just one curious question. 
When is the incubator- been removed from the github mirror ? So we can have github.com/apache/zeppelin ?

Thanks for explaining! 

So as far as I have understood, the pain point is: after `mvn clean`, on the same repo `mvn validate` faild due to  `maven-download-plugin` exception

```
iO Error: Destination '/opt/zeppelin-master/spark-dependencies/target/../../.spark-dist/spark-1.6.1.tgz' directory cannot be created 
```

who presumably complaining about non-existant `/target/` part of it's destination path?

and what you suggest is that we put there some different path, that is not target-related, and what I suggest is that we better make it still pointing to the same `.spark-dist` dir, one level above the repo root.

`${session.executionRootDirectory}/../.spark-dist` sounds as a good solution to me. 

Or another, harder way could be: if you could provide the stack trace of the same error (running `mvn -X ...`) we could look into the implementation of [maven-download-plugin](https://github.com/maven-download-plugin/maven-download-plugin) and see if we could improve it to behave like `mkdir -p` in this case.

Hi @prabhjyotsingh  @felixcheung , the PR  in #827 sound like it is the same as our PR. So, I agree with you that we might be duplicating the feature. Anyway, I have suggested a small change in your PR. You can find it at #944  . It mainly adds some important configuration to spark in Yarn mode.
So how are we on this?
Modification was completed. Please review for this PR.

@bzz What you have seen is different from the first error. Have you ever seen the first one before? I'll make a new issue for second error with `flaky-test` tag.

And it's good to remain documentation about hive until - may be - 0.7.0 to guide that users use a JDBC interpreter to use hive. I'll update hive.md again.
@bzz I made a https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-936

@jongyoul I saw you are working on applying new mechanism to all of the existing interpreters in [ZEPPELIN-804](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-804) as subtasks. I think this bug was caused since `interpreterGroup`, `interpreterName` and `interpreterClassName` that I deactivated were not matched with `group` in [here](https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-web/src/app/interpreter/interpreter-create/interpreter-create.html#L32). So if you have a better way to solve this bug, just let me know :)
Merge if there're no more discussions
@cloverhearts Thanks for addressing that! LGTM 👍

@jongyoul changes looks good to me. About the documentation I think same as @bzz for the users who were already using hive interpreter. I think it would be good to keep hive.md document and mention that hive interpreter is merged into master and refer the jdbc interpreter doc link.

Refactored the dependencies out of spark/pom.xml

Shouldn't be any conflicts now.

Also addressed @Leemoonsoo comments re: adding properties only if "spark.mahout" is true

It is on the use to specify the directory which contain the nessecary Mahout jars.  Talking to the Mahout community to make these exist in a consistent place in src/binaries of Mahout

And intellij took a lot of liberties refactoring my imports... going to change those back and re push

_update_ ok looking good now. I think the actual patch looks really nice now.  All that should be left is documentation.
And i think it's good idea to add new configuration to https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/docs/interpreter/spark.md#configuration
Looks good to me +1
LGTM
LGTM +1

@AhyoungRyu I've tested and reproduced what you mentioned. Your change looks simple but it's not perfect because you cannot see spark interpreter in your interpreter list because interpreter-setting.json read `interpreterGroup`, `interpreterName` and `interpreterClassName` while initialisation. I'll submit a PR into your branch. Thanks for reporting this.
I don't know whether front-end uses RegisteredInterprerter. We need to find a way to indicate or mark which class is used in front and backend.
@jongyoul I see. That's why I can't see `Spark` interpreter in the list. Thanks ! Okay i'll check ASAP.
@AhyoungRyu Could you please add "[HOTFIX]" in a title?
@jongyoul Yeah I just added :)
LGTM

I believe it will this feature is in the future as required.
